data: Creates a WordNet-based lexical resource that assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic web technologies for better recognition, interpretation, and processing of opinions in this context.

Includes entity-sentiment annotation to address the problem of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This manually annotated dataset with over 10,700 news headlines provides insight into sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relations within financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial news.
Compiled from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, it allows researchers to examine how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, which helps identify and classify financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial dataset for NLP with headlines of real financial articles in 15 languages. Annotated with high and low-level topics, facilitating multi-category and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Created by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data and provides training data for answering complex financial queries.
